column4: on my compaq presario v2000, i have setup all the drivers and blacklisted bcm43xx.  if i do a ndiswrapper -l it says bcmwl5 driver installed, hardware present....i restart, and when i do, the wireless light ont eh laptop just blinks, it doe snot stay constant which is what it does on windows.  i cannot access the internet or router either
That's bizarre.  I'm on a Presario v2565us (that's v2000 series as well) and ndiswrapper has been working for me.
do you have any ideas
Like what did u do after u installed the drivers?
Try this: sudo rmmod bcm43xx; sudo modprobe ndiswrapper; sudo depmod -a;
this could be the issue, it says ERROR: Module bcm34xx does not exist in /proc/modules
Don't worry, that just means that bcm43xx wasn't already there.  We were removing (rm)ing it anyway.
OK.  Now that that's done.  Please pastebin the output of sudo iwconfig and sudo ifconfig
how do i pastebin
Type "/topic" into your IRC chat program and click on the "Pastes to" link
i can't exactly do a paste.... i'm on a different computer
Oh, of course.
when i plug it in i cannot get connect either....i can access the router, but i cannot access the intnet
That sounds like a DNS issue.
i thought about that, the forums say add the ISP DNS to the list......i don't understand that...how do i know the ISP DNS ip?
On your other computer, try navigating to this IP address in your browser; http://72.14.207.99
nope....didn't work
Hm.  OK, on your working computer, ping google.com and write down its IP address.  Then try navigating to that IP address in the browser of your laptop.
nothing
OK, it's not STRICTLY a DNS issue.  If it was, that would work.
yay
Unfortunately, I don't really have the time to help you in depth... I'm trying to figure out something on my own at the moment.
Umm... ok, summarize what you see when you type iwconfig and ifconfig
shucks...thanks anyways
